subject: Communication
title: Cognitive Load and Deception
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cognitive Load and Deception.

hook.text: Lying is mentally exhausting. You must invent a story, suppress the truth, and monitor the listener simultaneously.

buildup.text: This cognitive load leaves telltale signs: slower speech, fewer details, and reduced gesturing.

discovery.text: Vrij's research found that increasing cognitive load â€” asking liars to tell the story backward â€” exposes them.

twist.text: Truth-tellers handle the added load fine. Liars buckle because they're already at mental capacity.

climax.text: UK police now use cognitive interview techniques that increase mental demand to detect inconsistencies.

punchline.text: The best lie detector isn't a machine. It's a harder question.

quiz.question: Why does increasing cognitive load help detect liars?
options: Liars are already at mental capacity and buckle under more load
